key_title: Key to the species of Pappochroma

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Erigeron
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria, Volume 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Erigeron. In: Walsh, N.G., Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria, Volume 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves glabrous or if hairy with few marginal setae
Leaves more or less covered with multicellular or glandular hairs, margins more or less ciliate with multicellular hairs

Plants with spreading, slender, often branched rhizomes; leaves crowded but rarely truly rosetted at base, passing gradually into bracts of peduncles; involucre to 1.5 cm wide at maturity; plants of moist mossbeds, heathlands and swampy sites
Plants with short, thickish rhizomes, solitary or colony-forming; leaves in a basal rosette, distinctly differentiated form bracts of peduncles; involucre 1.2–2.5 cm wide at maturity
Leaves non-viscid, hirsute with multicellular hairs
Leaves viscid (often shining) from more or less sessile glandular hairs
